data.1: SAY: "I HAVE been informed that a number of jinns had listened; then said: ´We have heard the wondrous Qur´an,
data.2: Which guides to the right path; and we have come to believe in it, and will not associate any one with our Lord.
data.3: Exalted is the glory of our Lord; He has neither wife nor son.
data.4: Certainly the foolish among us say preposterous things of God.
data.5: We had in fact thought that men and jinns would never speak a lie about God,
data.6: But some men used to seek refuge with some jinns, and this increased their waywardness;
data.7: So they began to think, even as you do, that God would not resurrect any one.
data.8: We sought to pry into the secrets of the heavens, but found it full of fierce guards and shooting flames.
data.9: We sat in observatories to listen; but any one who listened found a shooting star in wait for him.
data.10: We do not know if this means ill for the dwellers of the earth, or their Lord wishes guidance for them.
data.11: For some of us are upright and some otherwise: Surely we follow different ways.
data.12: We realised that we could not weaken the power of God on earth, nor outpace Him by running away.
data.13: So when we heard the guidance we believed in it; and he who believes in his Lord will neither fear loss nor force.
data.14: Some of us have come to submission, and some of us are iniquitous.´" Those who have submitted have taken the right course;
data.15: But those who are iniquitous will be fuel for Hell.
data.16: (Say): "If they keep to the right path We shall give them water in abundance to drink
data.17: In order to try them through it. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, will be given increasing torment by Him."
data.18: All places of worship are for God; so do not invoke any one with God.
data.19: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
data.20: Say: "I call on my Lord alone and I do not associate any one with Him."
data.21: Say: "Neither is your loss within my power nor bringing you to guidance."
data.22: Say: "No one can save me from God, nor can I find a place of refuge apart from Him,
data.23: Unless I convey from God and deliver His message." For those who disobey God and His Apostle is the fire of Hell, where they will abide for ever;
data.24: Until they see what they are promised, when they will understand who is weaker in aid and poorer in numbers.
data.25: Say: "I do not know if what is promised you is near, or if my Lord prolongs its term.
data.26: He is the knower of the Unknown, and He does not divulge His secret to any one
data.27: Other than an apostle He has chosen, when He makes a sentinel walk in front of him and a sentinel behind,
data.28: So that He may know if they have delivered their Lord´s messages. He comprehends all that has been given them, and keeps count of everything.
